comments:
Max OS X 10.3
Eclipse 2.1.3
CME 0.1.1
Apple-JDK 1.4.2_03-117.1

When executing a query in the "CME Search" panel, a popup comes up and an
exception is written to the logfile.
That cancels the execution of the search. :-(

The classes mentioned are part of the used JDK, though.


Here's the stacktrace:

Juri, thanks for the bug report. We're going to have a hard time progressing
this from here as we don't have a Mac. I'm assigning it to the query component,
mainly to see if anyone in Watson has access to a Mac - it does look more like a
Mac problem, rather than a query problem. Could you perhaps try some simple uses
of Java's regexp classes in your Mac environment to see if the problem is
specific to the CME?

We'll do some tests, then and if that doesn't help instrument Puma as needed to
shed some light on the matter.
We could reassign that bug to me if that would help.

Sorry about the late comment on this, but the immediate exception:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/util/regex/PatternSyntaxException

suggests there's something wrong with your JDK.  (You *are* using 1.4.2, yes?)
